properties.areaDesc: Inland Miami-Dade County; Far South Miami-Dade County; Coastal Miami Dade County
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 31 at 10:23PM EST by NWS Miami FL
properties.description:
* At 1021 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong to severe
thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles southwest of
Chokoloskee to 14 miles south of Wilderness Waterway to 7 miles
southwest of East Cape Sable. Movement was east at 40 mph.

* Nickel size hail and wind gusts of 50 to 70 mph possible with
these storms. Present indications are that warnings may become
needed for Miami-Dade County within the next hour.

* Locations impacted include...
Homestead, Homestead General Airport, The Redland, Florida City,
Royal Palm Ranger, Shark Valley Obs Tower, Intersection Krome And
Kendall Drive, Mahogany Hammock, Miccosukee Resort, Pa-Hay-
Okee Overlook, Everglades National Park, Fortymile Bend, The
Hammocks, Leisure City, Country Walk, Richmond West, Kendall West
and Inlikita.
properties.instruction:
These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio
stations and available television stations for additional
information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms, and may lead
to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded
roadways.

Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. If
you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck! Seek a safe
shelter inside a building or vehicle.

This activity was also developing in an environment favorable for the
formation of funnel clouds. Stay tuned to NOAA weather radio and
local media for additional updates and possible warnings.

To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement
agency. You can also share your report with NWS Miami on Facebook and
Twitter.

NWSheadline: SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ADVISORY FOR MIAMI-DADE COUNTY UNTIL 1045 PM EST
